question: In Daniel's vision, what did the statue's feet made of iron and clay represent?
choices: A divided kingdom
Rome
Future nations
The final empire
explanation: The feet of iron mixed with clay represent a divided kingdom, partly strong and partly brittle.

verses.kjv:
And whereas thou sawest the feet and toes, part of potters’ clay, and part of iron, the kingdom shall be divided; but there shall be in it of the strength of the iron, forasmuch as thou sawest the iron mixed with miry clay.
And
as the toes of the feet
were part of iron, and part of clay, so the kingdom shall be partly strong, and partly broken.
And whereas thou sawest iron mixed with miry clay, they shall mingle themselves with the seed of men: but they shall not cleave one to another, even as iron is not mixed with clay.

question: In Daniel's vision, which animal represented the Medo-Persian empire?
choices: A bear
A lion
A leopard
A goat
explanation: The bear with three ribs in its mouth represented the Medo-Persian empire in Daniel's vision.

verses.kjv:
And behold another beast, a second, like to a bear, and it raised up itself on one side, and
it had three ribs in the mouth of it between the teeth of it: and they said thus unto it, Arise, devour much flesh.

question: Who are the two witnesses in Revelation?
choices: Not specifically named
Moses and Elijah
Enoch and Elijah
Peter and Paul
explanation: The Bible describes two witnesses but doesn't name them, though they have powers similar to Moses and Elijah.

verses.kjv:
And I will give
power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred
and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.

question: According to Zechariah, what will come from the Mount of Olives?
choices: The Lord will stand on it and it will split
Fire will descend
Water will flow
Angels will appear
explanation: On that day his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, and it will be split in two from east to west.

verses.kjv:
And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which
is before Jerusalem on the east, and the mount of Olives shall cleave in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west,
and there shall be a very great valley; and half of the mountain shall remove toward the north, and half of it toward the south.

question: What is the last word in the book of Revelation?
choices: Amen
Jesus
Come
Forever
explanation: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with God's people. Amen.

verses.kjv:
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
be with you all. Amen.

question: Who will Jesus destroy with the breath of His mouth?
choices: The lawless one
The beast
Satan
Death
explanation: The Lord Jesus will overthrow the lawless one with the breath of his mouth and destroy by the splendor of his coming.

verses.kjv: And then shall that Wicked be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the spirit of his mouth, and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming:

question: According to Daniel, how many times will the Antichrist break his covenant?
choices: In the middle of the 'seven'
At the beginning
At the end
Never
explanation: In the middle of the 'seven' he will put an end to sacrifice and offering.

verses.kjv:
And he shall confirm the covenant with many for one week: and in the midst of the week he shall cause the sacrifice and the oblation to cease, and for the overspreading of abominations he shall make
it desolate, even until the consummation, and that determined shall be poured upon the desolate.

question: What are the two witnesses in Revelation clothed in?
choices: Sackcloth
White robes
Purple
Scarlet
explanation: I will appoint my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, clothed in sackcloth.

verses.kjv:
And I will give
power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred
and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.

question: What city is called 'Babylon the Great' in Revelation?
choices: A symbolic city representing evil
Literal Babylon
Rome
Jerusalem
explanation: The name written on her forehead was a mystery: BABYLON THE GREAT THE MOTHER OF PROSTITUTES.

verses.kjv:
And upon her forehead
was a name written, MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.

question: What are believers called in Revelation who have washed their robes?
choices: Those who made them white in the blood of the Lamb
Saints
The redeemed
The chosen
explanation: These are they who have come out of the great tribulation and washed their robes white in the blood of the Lamb.

verses.kjv: And I said unto him, Sir, thou knowest. And he said to me, These are they which came out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

question: How long will the two witnesses prophesy in Revelation?
choices: 1,260 days
3 and a half years
1,000 days
7 years
explanation: I will appoint my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days.

verses.kjv:
And I will give
power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred
and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.

question: What does the seventh trumpet announce?
choices: The kingdom of God has come
The end of the world
Final judgment
Christ's return
explanation: The seventh angel sounded his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven, which said: 'The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord.'

verses.kjv:
And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are become
the kingdoms of our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.

question: What happens to the sea when the second trumpet is sounded?
choices: A third of it turns to blood
It dries up
It becomes bitter
It freezes
explanation: The second angel sounded his trumpet, and something like a huge mountain, all ablaze, was thrown into the sea. A third of the sea turned into blood.

verses.kjv: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;

question: What follows the rider on the pale horse?
choices: Hades
Death
War
Famine
explanation: I looked, and there before me was a pale horse! Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following close behind him.

verses.kjv: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

question: Which church did Jesus say He would spit out of His mouth?
choices: Laodicea
Ephesus
Sardis
Thyatira
explanation: So, because you are lukewarm—neither hot nor cold—I am about to spit you out of my mouth.

verses.kjv: So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.

question: Which church left its first love?
choices: Ephesus
Smyrna
Pergamum
Laodicea
explanation: Yet I hold this against you: You have forsaken the love you had at first.

verses.kjv:
Nevertheless I have
somewhat against thee, because thou hast left thy first love.

question: What is the name of the place where kings gather for battle in Revelation?
choices: Armageddon
Megiddo
Babylon
Gog
explanation: Then they gathered the kings together to the place that in Hebrew is called Armageddon.

verses.kjv: And he gathered them together into a place called in the Hebrew tongue Armageddon.

question: In Zechariah's vision, how many horns scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem?
choices: Four horns
Seven horns
Ten horns
Two horns
explanation: Zechariah saw four horns which had scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then lifted I up mine eyes, and saw, and behold four horns. And I said unto the angel that talked with me, What be these? And he answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.

question: In Matthew, what sign did Jesus say would appear in heaven before all the tribes of the earth mourn and see the Son of man coming?
choices: The sign of the Son of man in heaven
A star falling upon the third part of the rivers
A rainbow round about the throne
A pillar of cloud by day and fire by night
explanation: Matthew 24:30 states that the sign of the Son of man will appear in heaven, and then the tribes of the earth will mourn and see Him coming in the clouds with power and great glory.

verses.kjv: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

question: In 1 Thessalonians, what did Paul say would happen to the dead in Christ at the Lord's coming?
choices: They shall rise first
They shall remain asleep until the end of the world
They shall be turned to dust forever
They shall be judged immediately without resurrection
explanation: 1 Thessalonians 4:16 teaches that the dead in Christ will rise first when the Lord descends from heaven with a shout.

verses.kjv: For the Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first:

question: In Revelation, what was written in the book that was opened, according to the dead being judged?
choices: The things which were written in the books, according to their works
Only the names of kings and rulers
The genealogies of Israel only
The secrets of the temple treasury
explanation: Revelation 20:12 says the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.

verses.kjv: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.

question: In Daniel, what did the prophet say would happen to many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth?
choices: Some shall awake to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt
All shall remain asleep forever
Only kings shall awake to life
They shall awake to reign over the earth for a thousand years
explanation: Daniel 12:2 teaches a resurrection: some to everlasting life and some to shame and everlasting contempt.

verses.kjv: And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt.

question: According to Revelation, what did John see coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband?
choices: The holy city, new Jerusalem
A great mountain burning with fire
The tabernacle of Moses
A temple made with hands
explanation: Revelation 21:2 describes John seeing the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

verses.kjv: And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

question: In 2 Peter, what did Peter say would pass away with a great noise?
choices: The heavens
The covenant
The law
The temple only
explanation: 2 Peter 3:10 says the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat.

verses.kjv: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.

question: In Revelation, what was given to the woman in the wilderness so she might fly into her place?
choices: Two wings of a great eagle
A crown of twelve stars
A rod of iron
A golden censer
explanation: Revelation 12:14 says two wings of a great eagle were given to the woman so she could fly into the wilderness to be nourished for a time, times, and half a time.

verses.kjv: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.

question: In Revelation, what did the angel say the seven stars in Christ's right hand are?
choices: The angels of the seven churches
The seven spirits of the earth
The seven seals
The seven trumpets
explanation: Revelation 1:20 explains that the seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven candlesticks are the seven churches.

verses.kjv: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks. The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches: and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches.

question: According to Revelation, what did John see in the right hand of him that sat on the throne?
choices: A book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals
A sword of fire
A scroll of the law of Moses
A golden crown with twelve stars
explanation: Revelation 5:1 describes a book in the right hand of him that sat on the throne, written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

verses.kjv: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

question: In Revelation, what did the angel say would be the torment of those who worship the beast and his image?
choices: He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb
He shall be cast into a dungeon of iron without light
He shall be turned into salt before all men
He shall wander the earth as a fugitive forever
explanation: Revelation 14:10 states that those who worship the beast will be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and the Lamb.

verses.kjv: The same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:

question: In Revelation, what did John see coming out of the sea in his vision?
choices: A beast having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his horns ten crowns
A golden altar before the throne
A white horse with seven riders
A river of living water proceeding from the throne
explanation: Revelation 13:1 describes a beast rising up out of the sea with seven heads and ten horns and ten crowns on his horns.

verses.kjv: And I stood upon the sand of the sea, and saw a beast rise up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his horns ten crowns, and upon his heads the name of blasphemy.

question: According to Revelation, what did John say he saw proceeding out of the throne?
choices: Lightnings and thunderings and voices
A river of fire and brimstone
Seven swords of iron
A cloud of smoke that darkened the sun
explanation: Revelation 4:5 describes lightnings, thunderings, and voices proceeding out of the throne, and mentions seven lamps of fire burning before the throne.

verses.kjv: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

question: According to Mark, what did Jesus say to do when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it ought not?
choices: Let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains
Let them go into the synagogues and remain there
Let them gather at the sea and wait
Let them take up the sword and fight
explanation: Mark 13:14 instructs those in Judaea to flee to the mountains when they see the abomination of desolation standing where it ought not.

verses.kjv: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains:

question: In Luke, what did Jesus say would be upon the earth as distress of nations, with perplexity?
choices: The sea and the waves roaring
A river of blood flowing
A great famine in every city
A pillar of smoke covering the sun
explanation: Luke 21:25 describes distress of nations with perplexity and mentions the sea and the waves roaring.

verses.kjv: And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;

question: According to 1 Corinthians, what did Paul say concerning the sound of the trumpet at the last trump?
choices: The trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed
The trumpet shall sound, and the sea shall be dried up
The trumpet shall sound, and the temple shall be rebuilt
The trumpet shall sound, and the angels shall depart
explanation: 1 Corinthians 15:52 says at the last trump the trumpet shall sound and the dead shall be raised incorruptible and believers shall be changed.

verses.kjv: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

question: According to 2 Timothy, what did Paul say the Lord would give him "at that day"?
choices: A crown of righteousness
A sword of judgment
A throne in Jerusalem
A new name written on stone
explanation: 2 Timothy 4:8 says the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give Paul a crown of righteousness at that day, and not to him only, but to all who love his appearing.

verses.kjv: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

question: In Revelation, what did the angel say would be "time no longer"?
choices: There should be time no longer
There should be no more day and night
There should be no more sun and moon
There should be no more kings on the earth
explanation: Revelation 10:6 records the angel swearing that there should be time no longer.

verses.kjv: And sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:

question: According to Revelation, what does John say the testimony of Jesus is?
choices: The spirit of prophecy
The law of Moses
The power of the sword
The wisdom of the world
explanation: Revelation 19:10 explicitly says the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

verses.kjv: And I fell at his feet to worship him. And he said unto me, See thou do it not: I am thy fellowservant, and of thy brethren that have the testimony of Jesus: worship God: for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

question: According to John, what is the will of him that sent Jesus concerning those who see the Son and believe on him?
choices: That he may have everlasting life, and Jesus will raise him up at the last day
That he should never experience death in any form
That he should rule the kingdoms of the earth immediately
That he should return to Egypt and dwell there
explanation: John 6:40 states that everyone who sees the Son and believes on him may have everlasting life and will be raised up at the last day.

verses.kjv: And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.

question: According to Revelation, what did John say he saw standing in heaven as a sign, with which the seven plagues were finished?
choices: Seven angels having the seven last plagues
A lamb with seven horns
A dragon with ten crowns
An altar of gold with incense
explanation: Revelation 15:1 says John saw seven angels having the seven last plagues, for in them is filled up the wrath of God.

verses.kjv: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is filled up the wrath of God.

question: In Revelation, what did John say was given unto the locusts that came out of the smoke of the bottomless pit?
choices: Power, as the scorpions of the earth have power
Crowns of gold to rule the nations
The key to the bottomless pit
A rod of iron to smite the earth
explanation: Revelation 9:3 says locusts came out upon the earth and power was given unto them as scorpions have power.

verses.kjv: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth: and unto them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.

question: According to Isaiah, what will happen to the hosts of heaven in the day of the LORD?
choices: They shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison
They shall be crowned with gold and set over the nations
They shall flee into the wilderness and hide themselves for ever
They shall build a new temple upon the mountains
explanation: Isaiah says the host of the high ones and the kings of the earth will be gathered like prisoners and shut up, then visited after many days.

verses.kjv: And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be visited.

question: In Isaiah, what does the prophet say the LORD will do to the covering cast over all people and the vail spread over all nations?
choices: He will destroy it in this mountain
He will bind it with seven seals for ever
He will cast it into the bottomless pit
He will spread it over the whole earth again
explanation: Isaiah 25:7 states that the LORD will destroy the covering and the vail that is spread over the nations.

verses.kjv: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.

question: According to Isaiah, what will the LORD do when he comes out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity?
choices: The earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain
The sea shall be turned into a plain, and the mountains melted
All nations shall gather to Jerusalem to make peace
The sun shall stand still for three days
explanation: Isaiah says the LORD will punish, and the earth will reveal blood and not cover the slain.

verses.kjv: For, behold, the LORD cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.

question: In Ezekiel, what did the LORD say he would do to Gog when he comes against the land of Israel in the latter days?
choices: He will bring him against his land, that the heathen may know him, when he shall be sanctified in him, O Gog, before their eyes
He will make him king over Jerusalem for a thousand years
He will lead him to build the temple and restore the sacrifices
He will cause him to flee to Egypt and hide among the nations
explanation: Ezekiel 38:16 says the LORD will bring Gog against the land so the nations may know him when God is sanctified in Gog before their eyes.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt come up against my people of Israel, as a cloud to cover the land; it shall be in the latter days, and I will bring thee against my land, that the heathen may know me, when I shall be sanctified in thee, O Gog, before their eyes.

question: According to Ezekiel, what does the Lord GOD say will happen to the land after it is cleansed?
choices: It shall be tilled and sown
It shall be burned with fire and become a desert for ever
It shall be covered with water and become as the sea
It shall be divided into ten kingdoms
explanation: Ezekiel 36:9 says God will turn unto the land, and it shall be tilled and sown.

verses.kjv: For, behold, I am for you, and I will turn unto you, and ye shall be tilled and sown:

question: In Ezekiel, what did the LORD say he would do so that the heathen would know that he is the LORD, when he is sanctified in Israel before their eyes?
choices: He will bring them out from the people, and gather them out of the countries, and bring them to their own land
He will set up an everlasting kingdom in Babylon
He will give them a new law by the hand of an angel
He will cause the sun to be darkened for forty days
explanation: Ezekiel 36:23–24 connects God's sanctifying of his great name with gathering Israel from the nations back to their land.

verses.kjv: And I will sanctify my great name, which was profaned among the heathen, which ye have profaned in the midst of them; and the heathen shall know that I am the LORD, saith the Lord GOD, when I shall be sanctified in you before their eyes.

question: According to Ezekiel, what does the LORD say will happen when the sanctuary is in the midst of Israel for evermore?
choices: The heathen shall know that the LORD do sanctify Israel
All nations shall cease to exist
The stars of heaven shall fall to the earth
The sea shall no more be
explanation: Ezekiel 37:28 says the nations will know the LORD sanctifies Israel when his sanctuary is in their midst for evermore.

verses.kjv: And the heathen shall know that I the LORD do sanctify Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them for evermore.

question: In Joel, what will the sun and the moon be like before the great and terrible day of the LORD come?
choices: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood
The sun shall be seven times brighter, and the moon shall vanish
The sun shall stand still, and the moon shall fall
The sun shall be covered with clouds, and the moon shall be broken
explanation: Joel 2:31 explicitly says the sun will be turned into darkness and the moon into blood before the day of the LORD.

verses.kjv: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and the terrible day of the LORD come.

question: According to Joel, what will the LORD do for his people in the day he gathers the nations and brings them down into the valley of Jehoshaphat?
choices: The LORD will be the hope of his people, and the strength of the children of Israel
The LORD will cause them to wander forty years in the wilderness again
The LORD will remove his name from Israel for a season
The LORD will deliver them into captivity under Assyria
explanation: Joel 3:16 says the LORD will roar out of Zion and be the hope and strength of his people.

verses.kjv: The LORD also shall roar out of Zion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem; and the heavens and the earth shall shake: but the LORD will be the hope of his people, and the strength of the children of Israel.

question: In Zephaniah, what does the LORD say he will do to the nations in the day of his determination?
choices: He will gather the nations, assemble the kingdoms, and pour upon them his indignation
He will crown them with peace and give them a new covenant
He will cause them to sleep, and forget their sins for ever
He will remove all judgment from the earth and end all war
explanation: Zephaniah 3:8 says God will gather nations and pour out indignation; the whole earth will be devoured with the fire of his jealousy.

verses.kjv: Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the LORD, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

question: According to Zephaniah, what does the LORD say he will turn to the people after the judgments?
choices: A pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve him with one consent
A sword of iron, that they may conquer every nation
A new temple in Babylon, that they may worship there
A veil over their eyes, that they may not understand
explanation: Zephaniah 3:9 says God will turn to the people a pure language so they may call on the LORD and serve with one consent.

verses.kjv: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve him with one consent.
